title: 111_hr6546
content: The Act titled "Transportation Infrastructure Improvements on Federal Lands Act of 2010" focuses on Federal Lands Highways. The Act "Transportation Infrastructure Improvements on Federal Lands Act of 2010" amends sections of title 23, United States Code to include Federal land management agencies in preventive maintenance and allow funds for maintenance of highways, roads, and parkways. The Act authorizes funding from the Highway Trust Fund for maintenance of highways, roads, parkways, and trails on public lands, national parks, and Indian reservations to improve asset management. $500,000,000 is authorized for fiscal year 2011 and $550,000,000 for fiscal year 2012. The funding authorized for maintenance of highways, roads, parkways, and trails on public lands, national parks, and Indian reservations increases annually from $550 million in 2012 to $800 million in 2016. SEC. 3 amends Section 117(d) of title 23, United States Code to specify that the Federal share of project costs on public lands, Indian reservations, national parks, or wildlife refuges shall be 100 percent. The amendment applies to projects authorized after the enactment of this Act. SEC. 4 addresses alternative transportation in parks and public lands. The amendment to Section 5320(c)(5) of title 49, United States Code includes adding a new project category (H) for financing operating costs of fixed guideway projects and systems, buses, and comprehensive alternative transportation programs lasting more than one year in eligible areas. The Mass Transit Account of the Highway Trust Fund provides funding for operating fixed guideway projects, buses, and related facilities under section 5309(b). Authorization amounts for fiscal years 2011 to 2016 are specified, with a minimum of 60% allocated for projects in national parks under section 5320. Amounts from the Mass Transit Account of the Highway Trust Fund must allocate at least 60% for projects in national parks. These funds are considered as grants under section 5338 of title 49, United States Code.
